intro: Labordia fagraeoidea f. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous fagraeoidea, is a variant of the species Labordia fagraeoidea, a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its smooth, hairless leaves and stems, distinguishing it from the typical form of the species. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is known for its ornamental value. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and taxonomic studies.
